page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Chedworth is a small,quiet village. the buildings are scattered,some are very old and some are still being built.The Romans lived here there was a villa opposite our church. The church is Norman and so probably is the very fine Manor.Most of the cottages are built with cotswold stone and have beautiful gardens. Many activities take place for young and old.This is a community where people like to join in and to help others.There are two flower shows,an amateur drama group,a parents association,football and cricket clubs ,a W.I. and several church groups.In the spring there is an Easter Event with many stalls in the modern village hall.At Christmas there is carol singing at the pub.We have fetes, rummage,coffee mornings and charity lunches and a harvest supper.
